title: Tarayıcım Çok Yavaş
content:
Merhaba,

Firefox Developer Edition kullanıcısıyım. Çok uzun süredir sorunsuz kullanıyorum ancak yaklaşık bir haftadır arama yaparken çok çok yavaş çalışıyor. DuckDuckGo kullandığım için olabileceğini düşünüp arama motorumu değiştirdim fakat bir düzelme olmadı. Tüm eklentilerin devre dışı kalması için güvenli modda açıp test ettim ancak sonuç yine aynı. Kullandığım profili tüm ayarları aynı şekilde ofis bilgisayarımda sorunsuz bir şekilde kullanıyorum. Sorun tarayıcının çalışmasından ziyade arama yaparken yaşanıyor. Güvenlik ayarlarını da (çerezleri engelleme vb.) kapattım ancak düzelmedi. Uygulayabileceğim bir fikri olan var mı?

Sorun yaşadığım bilgisayarın özellikleri: GTX 1050 - i7 7700HQ - 16GB Ram

Sorunsuz çalışan ofis bilgisayarım: GTX 1650 - i5 9300H - 16GB Ram

title: Increase number of bookmark folders when bookmarks get saved - THIS WORKS
content:
The solution given by cor-el works very well.

Thanks cor-el ! I needed that.

But you won't know it until you access more unique folders than you already have in the list.

For instance, when you access the 8th folder that is different it will be sticky, when you access a 9th that is different it will be sticky. Kind of like a "most recently used" list. You won't see the extras until they happen.

Solution given by Cor-el: There is a pref on the about:config page that defaults to 7 to set the number of entries to show in this list of recently used folders. 

- about:config => browser.bookmarks.editDialog.maxRecentFolders = 7 - https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/about-config-editor-firefox

Original post at: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1410392#answer-1574837

Thanks again,

Mike.
creator: mnixon1930

title: Firefox automatically updated to the latest version 124.0.1 and all of my bookmarks are gone. How do I get them back?
content:
Please help.

I have always loved Firefox. I started using it because it did not constrict the user to the limits of the narrow minded Microsoft Explorer (Edge). But, this latest update reminds me of what I came to Firefox for. I hope Firefox is not going to become the same way. This latest update (124.0.1) just didn't care about my bookmarks or extensions or anything. It just installed a new version and left it at that. I had several tabs open. Gone. I had several bookmarks. Gone. All extensions. Gone.

For a long time Firefox just updated and left all of those things in tact. What happened?? More importantly, does anyone know how to get these things back?

I would really appreciate your help.

Thank you, Luke

SOLVED !!! Unfortunately, today, automatic update got error "CAN'T LOAD XPCOM" and then I performed Firefox reinstall exactly as indicated by Kobe 26/09/13, 05:40 at https://support.mozilla.org/it/questions/972465 but at the end o process all my firefox bookmarks links are LOST ! I still have original Firefox installation folder (that was in C:\Program Files (x86)\Mozilla Firefox) in the Recycle Bin .... Is it possible to recover and restore original PROFILE FOLDER ??? any hint ? thanks and regards ! Rudy

Then I looked for and found pages related to PROFILE FOLDER and how to restore the auto saved bookmarks "folder" .... so I was able to recover my Profile and overcome my worries !

creator: mlooney30

title: Gmail constantly refreshes browser tab
content:
I installed Firefox on a new computer running Windows 11. I use the X-notifier plug-in to access my Gmail account but can't get X-notifer to run properly on this new install. I was getting an error message, but now it says "Can always read and change data on this site" yet the envelope icon does not appear in my tool bar like it does on my old computer.

As an alternative, I signed into my Gmail account so I can read my email on a browser page. While that works, it works too well -- as soon as a new email arrives, the browser tab running Gmail pops to the top and interrupts anything that I am doing -- even when I am typing a new email or filling out a form on another tab.

The only way I can deal with this is 1) sign out of Gmail until I want to check it, or 2) pull the Gmail tab to a separate window and minimize it so it can't interfere with what I am doing.

I'd like to know if there is a fix for the X-notifier plug-in or a way to stop the Gmail tab from "taking over" the browser.
creator: ksgarvin

title: Some local plaintext files in latin encoding rendered with japanese font settings
content:
A certain set of plaintext files are rendered in a weird way when opened in Firefox.

Some plaintext files are rendered "MS Gothic", which is the default monospace font for plaintext files in Japanese encoding. (Also, if I change font.name-list.monospace.ja to "monospace", the font changes).

However, the files are not in Japanese encoding, they do not contain a single character in Japanese encoding. Since the files are local, they have no HTTP headers to determine the encoding, so Firefox must have guessed the encoding somehow. How can I stop firefox from detecting those files as Japanese while they are not?

Also, I noticed that this issue happens only with long files. The shorter a file, the less likely it is that Firefox renders the file as if it had Japanese encoding.

Since I cannot reproduce the issue with smaller files and the files contain confidential information, I am unable to provide a minimal reproducer.

As a workaround, I could change font.name-list.monospace.ja, but this would change (potentially break) rendering of Japanese websites.

I'm using Firefox 124.0.1 on Windows 10, although this issue has been present for at least some months (at least 4 firefox releases).

The screenshot shows an excerpt where the text "C:\Temp\2024-" is partially rendered with Japanese glyphs and fully rendered with "MS Gothic" font which is hard to read with ASCII characters.

PS: I [censored] some of the information in the "Troubleshooting Information" field below.
creator: christian.stadelmann

title: organizer marque pages
content:
In French ('English underneath) J'essaye d'organizer mes marque pages 1)Je tape sur supprimer, la page revient à la prochaine application 2)Je crée un dossier. Dans des versions anterieures de Firefox, on pouvait simplement bouger les fiches avec controle>fleche jusqu'a le dossier. (Il n,y avait pas le separateur <autres marques pages>) Avant l'essai de reorganization, <autres marques pages> contenait la plupart des fiches, les marques pages normales (bouton >>je presume) contenait seulement une demi douzaine choisis au hazard. Apres l'installation des dossiers, <autres marque pages> contient seulement les dossiers, bouton >> toutes les fiches. Il est impossible de transferer de bouton >> jusqu'a <autres marque pages>, afin d'incluire les fiches dans un dossier.

I am trying to organize my bookmarks. 1)I press the delete button, the page comes back next time I open the computer 2)I create a file folder. In previous versions of Firefox ,there was no separator between bookmarks (button>> I assume) and <other bookmarks>, and one could transfer a file into a folder using control and the arrow. Before I tried to organize the bookmarks, <other bookmarks>for some reason contained nearly all my files, the button >> only a few chosen at hazard. Having created file folders, <other bookmarks> contains the folders, button >> all the files. It is impossible to transfer from button>> into the folders in <other bookmarks>.

title: Open All Bookmarks
content:
Hello! I'm trying to configure Firefox not to switch from the current tab, when I open multiple bookmarks by either middle click bookmark folder or right click the bookmark folder and select Open All Bookmarks. I've already set about:config browser.tabs.loadBookmarksInBackground True browser.tabs.loadDivertedInBackground True browser.tabs.loadInBackground True

If I'm browsing a page, and then decide to open several bookmarks that are in a bookmark folder, either via middle click or right click->Open All Bookmarks, Firefox will still switch to the first open bookmark.

I've tried Shift+Middle click and this one opens the bookmarks, without switching from the current tab. And Ctrl+Shift+right click->Open All Bookmarks and this one opens the bookmarks, without switching from the current tab.

So how do I configure Firefox to just use middle click on a bookmark folder, and then not have it switch to the first open bookmark? Thank you!

title: Assistance Needed with Firefox Browser and Group Policy Settings
content:
Hi there,

We are currently utilizing Windows Server 2019 as our development server. To maintain security protocols, we have implemented a Group Policy to block internet access on this server. Initially, this configuration successfully restricted internet access on all browsers, including Firefox. However, recently we encountered an issue where internet access became available solely through the Firefox browser, posing a significant data security risk.

Upon investigation, we discovered that Firefox allows users to modify proxy settings, effectively bypassing our Group Policy restrictions. Unlike other browsers, Firefox permits users to adjust proxy settings without sufficient rights, thus overriding our established restrictions.

To mitigate this issue, we require guidance on enforcing Group Policy settings within Firefox to prevent unauthorized alterations to proxy settings and ensure internet access remains restricted. It's important to note that Firefox is exclusively utilized for development purposes on our server.

Your assistance in resolving this matter would be greatly appreciated.

Regards, Hiten
creator: hitenj.trivedi

title: How do I contact QuickBooks support by phone? · Community
content:
If you still need assistance, please call us at 1-(844)-476-5438 (no wait time) or 1844-476-5438.

QuickBooks is a popular accounting software that helps businesses and individuals manage their finances efficiently. Although QuickBooks offers a user-friendly interface and comprehensive self-help resources, there may be times when you need direct assistance from our support team. This blog details how to efficiently contact QuickBooks Support at 1-(844)-476-5438. We’ll cover different support channels and tips to make the process as smooth as possible and ensure you get the help you need with your QuickBooks-related issues.

For more information, call 800-INTUIT QB 1-(844)-476-5438(no hold). Our professional QuickBooks team will help you right away.

title: Trying To Fix The Wrong Time in Firefox Ended Up Removing Firefox's Ability to Display a Player Within a Site if Another Site Has Embedded it.
content: My Firefox browser did not update with daylight savings (this is my first time being in a country with daylight savings with this PC) and now all in-browser times are an hour behind, which is already really confusing for someone experiencing daylight savings for the first time. Now that I do not have a phone, this went from mildly annoying to really messing up my day-to-day life. As a result, I researched, found and followed this question-and-answer proposed solution to my issue but it didn't work. Now, I've been pushed a step backward because I have also lost the ability to view TV shows and movies on third party websites because the player will not load and a 'Website will not allow Firefox to display the page if another site has embedded it' notice will pop up (image for reference). This is super infuriating due to the fact that my PC is older and genuinely cannot run any kind of chromium browser and Firefox is the only way I can access said third party sites. It would be wonderful is anyone had a solution for both issues; thank you!
